body.header: Part 1 of the interview is the easiest part of the exam to prepare for. The advice below should help you to do this.
body.section:
WAYS TO IMPROVE YOUR PERFORMANCE IN PART ONE
1 Arrange the main events of your life in order and find suitable linking phrases.
2 Think of questions the examiner might ask you about your schooldays/university life/work experience, and answer them.
3 Look at the answers below and you will see how each of them has been extended:
Q: Where did you go to school? A: I went to school near my home and I liked that because it meant my friends all lived in the same neighbourhood.
Q: What do you want to study at university? A: I want to study civil engineering because we had a serious earthquake in my area and I became interested in the reinforcement of buildings.
Q: How do you travel to work? A: I go to work by bus which is time-consuming and tiring, because buses are not regular and are often overcrowded.
4 Think of ways you can extend the answers to questions by adding other bits of interesting information.
